titles.title: To name certain facilities of the United States Postal Service in Baltimore, Maryland.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

bill.summary: 11/5/1999--Introduced. Designates the U.S. post offices located in Baltimore, Maryland, at: (1) 919 West 34th Street as the Samuel H. Lacy, Sr. Post Office; (2) 3500 Dolfield Avenue as the Judge Robert Bernard Watts, Sr. Post Office; (3) 1908 North Ellamont Street as the Dr. Flossie McClain Dedmond Post Office; (4) 900 East Fayette Street as the Judge Harry Augustus Cole Post Office; and (5) 1001 Frederick Road as the Frederick L. Dewberry, Jr. Post Office.
